summary:
Relighting Skyrim in a new light.
New from scratch approach for correcting lights, with much improved content for regular users to advanced users/modders.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#f1c232][b][size=6]INTRODUCTION[/size][/b][/color]
[size=3][b]This is a continuation of the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17609/?]Relighting Skyrim[/url] mod.
The work JawZ and NovakDalton did was immense, first lighting mod to really cover all of Skyrim plus it's official DLC's with Light Bulb fixes and corrections.
However we, the RSR team, were not content with the available modifications in RS. So we started from scratch, implementing new features from the ground up, to allow a better end user experience as well as end user customization options.


So without further ado, the RSR team presents:
[url=https://flic.kr/p/Gfx8EX][img]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7206/26418775943_6316ff8316_c.jpg[/img][/url]

[/b][/size]
[color=#f1c232][b][size=6]FEATURES[/size][/b][/color][color=#fff2cc][size=3]
-- Fixes shadow light flickering, "Zebra shadow"/low shadow bias light bulbs  --
-- Light bulbs placed at light sources according to their labeled name  --
-- Fixes light bulbs not casting light on to the landscape in exteriors  --[color=#fff2cc][size=3]
-- Custom Light bulbs to allow easy end user customization --[/size][/color]
-- Focus on vanilla visual style  --
-- Vanilla performance, at least as close as it can get  --[/size][/color][size=2]
[/size]

[color=#f1c232][b][size=6]LOAD ORDER[/size][/b][/color]
[color=#ffd966][size=5]General load order in combination with other mods[/size][/color]
[color=#fff2cc][size=3]Weather mods
[i][color=#fff2cc]RelightingSkyrim_Legendary.esp[/color][/i]
Interior lighting mods [i](With no light bulb changes!)
[/i][/size][/color]
As for other type of mods, let [b][url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url][/b] decide where in your specific load order is the best place for respective files available from this mod. Just keep in mind of having interior ambient/fog/directional lighting changing mods after the Relighting Skyrim file, like mentioned above.


[color=#f1c232][b][size=6]COMPATIBILITY[/size][/b][/color]
[color=#dd7e6b][size=3]- Not compatible -[/size][/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30450/?]Realistic Lighting Overhaul[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Enhanced Lights and FX[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17609/?]Relighting Skyrim[/url]

[color=#dd7e6b][size=3]- Compatible -[/size][/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59733/?]Enhanced Lighting for ENB[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]ELFX - Enhancer[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50065/?]Natural Lighting and Atmospherics for ENB[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29253/?]Remove Interior Fog V2[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13531/?]ULTRA REALISTIC WORLD LIGHTING for Skyrim[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1875/?]RCRN AE -- HDR Lighting and Weather Enhancement
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65242/?]Purity
[/url]

[color=#f1c232][b][size=6]UNINSTALL[/size][/b][/color]
[color=#ffd966][size=4]With NMM or Mod Organizer it's just a simple click procedure, very intuitive what to do using those tools.
The manual way is done by removing all files and folders listed below;[/size][/color]

[b]- Data/[color=#00ff00]RelightingSkyrim_Legendary.esp[/color] -
- Data/textures/[color=#00ff00]relightingskyrim[/color] -
- Data/meshes/[color=#00ff00]relightingskyrim[/color] -[/b]

[color=#ffd966][size=4]Those files are located here, using default Steam installation;[/size][/color]
[b]C:\Program Files (x86)\[color=#00ff00]Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim[/color][/b]
